title: Drawing, "Cupid raising bunches of flowers with both arms", 1710–28
markings: watermark:  two-pointed anchor in ovoid; above six-pointed star.  Below: "F"
signed: Signed in graphite, vertically at left: Paolo de Matteis F.
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, lower left: 209; lower right: g.180.
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Cupid shown from the front, standing upon a base looking upward.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Cupid raising bunches of flowers with both arms", 1710–28.
1710–28. Red chalk, graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6440.
